resources.string: Battleship (also Battleships or Sea Battle) is a guessing game for two players. It is played on ruled grids (paper or board) on which each players fleet of ships (including battleships) are marked. The locations of the fleets are concealed from the other player. Players alternate turns calling "shots" at the other players ships, and the objective of the game is to destroy the opposing players fleet.
Got any queries? We are happy to help!
Click to take a photo directly from camera
Are you sure you want to exit?

"Game modes

Against Computer : 
Play against computer AI
Against a friend : 
Play against a friend connected to the same network as you

Rules

The game board is 8x8.
At the beginning of the game each player is his fleet in places that do not want to board can guide the boats in the way they want.
Boats may not be placed on adjacent cells (vertically, horizontally or diagonal)
The first player to make shots on the opponent must be drawn at the beginning of game
Each player gives 3 shots, selecting the desired cell
Only after indicating the 3 shots do you receive information about any hits you got
If a player manages to hit all 3 of his shots, he can move one of their boats a position. This shift can be done for homes that to be occupied by a vessel which, in the meantime, has been sunk. Displacement should respect the rule that no adjacent cells
The game ends when the fleet of one of the opponents is totally sunk
"
